alert.note: Alert for Kingman; McPherson; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McPherson, eastern Reno, northwestern Sedgwick, western Harvey, northeastern Kingman, northwestern Marion and Saline Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 935 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Cambria to Haven. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salina, Hutchinson, Newton, Mcpherson, Hesston, Lindsborg, Maize, South Hutchinson, Halstead, Moundridge, Sedgwick, Inman, Colwich, Buhler, Haven, Burrton, Galva, Mount Hope, Canton and Pretty Prairie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 36 and 95. Interstate 70 between Mile Markers 247 and 266. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and central Kansas.
